item.title: Continuous-Discrete Bayesian Filtering for Stochastic Differential Equations
item.description:
Supervisor: Prof. Simo Särkkä, Aalto University

As part of the term project for Aalto University’s course on State Space Models, titled Non-linear Filtering and Parameter Estimation, I investigated the continuous-time Bayesian Filtering problem for continuous-time State Space Models governed by Stochastic Differential Equations. I studied the theory of continuous-time Markov Chains, Brownian Motion, Ito Calculus and and the Fokker Planck PDE. I also studied the Kushner-Stratonovich and Zakai Equations for likelihood calculations in SDE models. Finally, I studied and implemented exact and approximate Kalman Filters for Continuous-Discrete State Space Models, which are a special class of SDE based SSMs where the State Transition model is an SDE, and the observation model is discrete-time but may be non-uniform. The project report is available here and the implementations are available in this GitHub repository

item.title: Nonparametric Models for Image Generation and Interpolation
item.description:
Supervisor: Prof. Piyush Rai, IIT Kanpur

We developed a generative model for images that uses Probabilistic Second Order Neural ODEs to learn a distribution of smooth continuous-time interpolation trajectories for a given source-target pair, and generates individual images by temporal subsampling of random interpolation curves that are drawn from the conditional (conditioned on the source-target pair) distribution of trajectories. The resultant model was formulated as a modified Generative Adversarial Network with a non-parametric data dependent latent code prior. We qualitatively and quantitatively demonstrated that our non-parametric approach significantly outperforms baseline GAN and Bidirectional GAN models that impose a fixed prior on the latent code, on both image generation and interpolation. Furthermore, our approach also allowed conditional generation and interpolation on out-of-sample data at test-time, with zero training overhead. This work is currently submitted to the International Conference on Computer Vision (ICCV) 2021, and a preprint shall be made available soon.

item.title: Probabilistic Models for Joint Image and Video Generation
item.description:
Supervisors: Prof. Piyush Rai and Prof. Vinay Namboodiri, IIT Kanpur

We developed a hierarchical probabilistic model for joint image and video generation that first generates a summary frame for the video and then models individual frames by adding residual vectors to the summary frame’s latent representation at each timestep. We then developed an analogous hierarchy for models that disentangle content from motion by adding a residual content vector to the content summary representation at each timestep. We designed both VAE and GAN implementations of our proposed models and achieved significant improvements on quantitative metrics and human evaluation scores against appropriate image generation and video generation baseline. Our work is published at the Winter Conference on the Applications of Computer Vision (WACV) 2020

item.title: TorchGAN: A Flexible Framework for GAN Training and Evaluation
item.description: I co-developed TorchGAN, a lightweight customizable PyTorch framework for training and evaluation of Generative Adversarial Networks. This enjoyable passion project involved me embarking on a thorough survey of the GAN literature and writing efficient implementations of various GAN models, losses, evaluation metrics and stability enhancement features, all packaged into a highly customizable framework for effortlessly using them off-the-shelf or extending them. The GitHub Repository currently has over 1200 stars and a paper is currently submitted to the Journal of Open Source Software (JOSS)

item.title: Computational Models for Human Inference of Social Situations
item.description:
Supervisor: Prof. Nisheeth Srivastava, IIT Kanpur

The aim of the project was to characterize the nature and granularity of information about social interactions accessible to human observers from simple visual displays. To this end, we studied lay theories of human emotion modelling and developed a computational model for social situations involving few agents, based on the Valence Arousal Model of emotion detection and the Social Force Model for Pedestrian Dynamics

item.title: Attention Based Models for Image Captioning and Generation
item.description: As part of a summer project offered by Programming Club, IIT Kanpur, I studied the theory of encoder decoder sequence models, soft attention and hard attention and reproduced the results in Show Attend and Tell : Neural Image Caption Generation with Visual Attention

item.title: Case Studies : A Legal Consultant Bot
item.description: I developed a legal consultant bot that summarises a legal document, highlights the key phrases and answers some rudimentary questions about the document as part of the Microsoft code.fun.do Hackathon on AI and NLP. The task involved creating a custom dataset by scrapinng from an archive of Indian legal documents, and using the TextRank Algorithm and Latent Dirichlet Allocation on the large text corpora for topic modelling and extractive summarization. The project was selected as one of the top 3 ideas on campus by Microsoft India.
